availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hiram E. McElroy Jr. (Union County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Hiram McElroy and Mary McElroy. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Resident in Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Resident in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 504B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 327.
History of Union County, Kentucky: A Complete Account of the Settlement, Organization and Government of the County, Together with Facts and Figures Concerning the Society, Professions, Commerce, Industries, Agriculture, Coal, Railroads, Education, Religion, and Other Institutions and Resources of the County and Biographical Sketches of its Leading Citizens, (Evansville, IN: Courier Co., Printers, Binders and Engravers, 1886), 474-5.
Find A Grave, "Hiram McElroy (Jan. 12, 1837-Aug. 21-1910)," Memorial #92460257, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/92460257 (accessed January 20, 2020).
